greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Rectangular array: A(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..k} (-1)^floor(j/2)*binomial(k-floor((j+1)/2), floor(j/2))*(-n)^(k-j), n >= 1, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: This array is used to compute A269252: A269252(n) = least k such that |A(n,k)| is a prime, or -1 if no such k exists.
link: Andrew N. W. Hone, et al., On a family of sequences related to Chebyshev polynomials, arXiv:1802.01793 [math.NT], 2018.
formula: G.f. for row n: (1 + x)/(1 + n*x + x^2), n >= 1.
mathematica: A299045[n_, k_] := Sum[(-1)^(Floor[j/2]) Binomial[k - Floor[(j + 1)/2], Floor[j/2]] (-n)^(k - j), {j, 0, k}]; Flatten[Table[A299045[n - k, k], {n, 11}, {k, 0, n - 1}]]
xref: Cf. A094954 (unsigned version of this array, but missing the first row).
results.author: _L. Edson Jeffery_, _Bob Selcoe_ and _Andrew Hone_, Feb 01 2018
